answers.author: Leslie Beauregard
answers.text:
Well because it's never the case that revenues cover a department's expenditures 100% in the GF, parks and recreation an example, we look more at cost recovery.  If a department that generates revenue actually makes MORE revenue during a fiscal year, we may allow that department to do a supplemental appropriation during the fiscal year and use those funds for whatever purpose.  That's always approved by Council.  But at year end, those revenues revert to the GF as a general rule.

I have a member that is looking at how other municipalities earmark revenues.  Do you allow departments to see a direct correlation between the increased revenue and the department's increased budget allowed the following year or do all the funds go back into the general fund?  
Please fill out this one question survey:  https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/2LT9TQZ
Any help is greatly appreciated.
